summary: Familiar Breezehome, but a little bit refreshed.
descriptionHtml:
Requires Hearthfire.

Now in beta! Manually cleaned with TES5Edit, so it shouldn't be totally wonky anymore. Still need to rework the weapon displays and the mannequin, but it should be stable now, at least.

New additions to the entry way, rearranged the kitchen, expanded the loft (new mannequin heyo!), and added on to the master bedroom. Added a small cellar (via load door) with enchanting and alchemy stations. Plenty of storage, but i could probably have put more (and probably will, to be honest).

Before installing, please remove all your stuff from Breezehome. I deleted plenty of containers in the "common" class and replaced them with "upper" versions. The chest in the master bedroom was actually just moved so that one's probably okay, but play it safe and just take your stuff out.
author: morganmarz

files.name: Refreshed Breezehome Alpha
files.changelogHtml:
Master bedroom:
-Bookcase added
-Weapon plaque changed to elk head
-Bed changed to noble type

Loft:
-Added weapon plaque
-Added display case
-Added mannequin

Housecarl's room:
-Added weapon plaque

Kitchen:
-Rearranged eating area
-Added oven

Entry/Sitting/Firepit area:
-Added a weapon plaque
-Added a dagger display case

Alchemy laboratory:
-Accidentally completely removed during editing, probably won't put it back because it's redundant to the cellar

Cellar:
-Trapdoor under ladder to the loft
-Storage
-Weapon racks
-Bookshelves
-Alchemy+enchanting

files.name: Refreshed Breezehome Beta
files.changelogHtml:
-Cleaned with TES5Edit
-Mannequin should stay in place now
-Vanilla upgrading should work now, though the new additions aren't affected by that (might add that in later)
-Can no longer access master bedroom's bookshelf through the wall

Known bugs:
-Weapon displays are still all sorts of buggy.
-Mannequin isn't activatable. Might need to redo.
